H0.text: Insects are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H1.text: Spiders are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H2.text: Crustaceans are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

H3.text: Corals are by far the most common type of invertebrate.

A4.text: Arthropoda is the largest animal phylum, with estimates of the number of arthropod species varying from 1,170,000 to 5~10 million and accounting for over 80 percent of all known living animal species.

A5.text: One arthropod sub-group, the insects, includes more described species than any other taxonomic class.
